text: The 2000–01 Algerian Championnat National was the 39th season of the Algerian Championnat National since its establishment in 1962. A total of 16 teams contested the league, with CR Belouizdad as the defending champions, The Championnat started on September 7, 2000. and ended on June 25, 2001. ==Team summaries== === Promotion and relegation === Teams promoted from Algerian Division 2 2000–2001 * CA Bordj Bou Arreridj * RC Kouba Teams relegated to Algerian Division 2 2001–2002 * USM El Harrach * CS Constantine ==League table== ==Result table== ==Season statistics== ===Top scorers=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Scorer !Club !Goals |- !|1 |align="left"| Issaad Bourahli |align="left"|ES Sétif | style="text- align:center;"|16 |- !|2 |align="left"| Tarek Hadj Adlane |align="left"|USM Alger | style="text-align:center;"|13 |- !|3 |align="left"| Fawzi Moussouni |align="left"|JS Kabylie | style="text-align:center;"|13 |- !|4 |align="left"| Kamel Kherkhache |align="left"|USM Blida | style="text-align:center;"|12 |- !|5 |align="left"| Billal Zouani |align="left"|USM Blida | style="text- align:center;"|12 |- !|6 |align="left"| Fares Djabelkhir |align="left"|USM Annaba | style="text-align:center;"|10 |- !|7 |align="left"| Mounir Dob |align="left"|JS Kabylie | style="text-align:center;"|10 |- !|8 |align="left"| Hamid Berguiga |align="left"|USM El Harrach | style="text-align:center;"|9 |- !|9 |align="left"| Moulay Meziane |align="left"|MC Oran | style="text- align:center;"|9 |} ==References== ==External links== *2000–01 Algerian Championnat National Algerian Championnat National Championnat National Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 seasons
